# GROUP CLASSES

Here’s Our Gym Classes For Those Who Enjoy The Camaraderie Of Training In A
Group While Getting Functionally Stronger!

![Strength Classes Singapore](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/plugins/masterslider/public/assets/css/blank.gif)

# GROUP CLASSES

# GROUP CLASSES

[ PROGRESSIVE STRENGTH CLASSES MEMBERSHIP
](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/strength-yard-progressive-strength-classes/)

**Master Compound Barbell Movements** to help you get **Functionally
Stronger** and better in your everyday life.

 **This class is suitable for Beginners (both male and female of various age
groups)** and is an ideal option for people who are looking **to become
functionally stronger or to kickstart their Powerlifting Journey.**

[ GOLD CLASS FOR SENIORS MEMBERSHIP
](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/progressive-strength-classes-gold-class-for-
seniors/)

**Similar to our Progressive Strength Class except that it is catered to our
seniors.**  
The gold classes are conducted at a much gentler pace ensuring that no one
gets left behind.

Our well designed regiment will help you **prevent muscle degeneration, combat
the effects of aging and improve your quality of life.**  
Take charge of your health now and join us today!

#

# GROUP COURSES

Master The Intricacies Of Training With A Barbell With Our Barbell Courses.
Focus On Your Form And Technique To Set A Strong Foundation.

[ BEGINNER OLYMPIC WEIGHLIFTING COURSE
](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/beginner-olympic-weightlifting-course/)

Over the course of 4 weeks, **Individuals will learn and become proficient in
the Clean & Jerk and the Snatch. **This is the foundation of this course.

This is a progressive fundamental course emphasizing technique and form for
novice to advanced weightlifters.

This course is perfect for beginners, men and ladies alike.

[ BARBELL FUNDAMENTALS ](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/barbell-fundamentals-
strength-and-conditioning-gym-singapore/)

Over the course of 2 days, learn how to perform the basic barbell lifts safely
and efficiently under the instruction of our coaches.

This is a workshop designed for beginners to receive coaching on the proper
form and technique for the **Squat, Bench, Deadlift and Overhead Press.**

Trust us to help you achieve your fitness goals, small or large.

Why should you consider personal training?

It’s expert training, on your schedule.

Whether you train one-on-one or as part of a privately booked group,

Our experienced [training staff](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/our-team/)
will customize a program for you that fits your unique goals and busy
schedule.

## **BECOME STRONGER AND LEANER**

![the-strength-yard-personal-training-
barbell](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)![the-
strength-yard-personal-training-barbell](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/the-strength-yard-personal-training-barbell.png)

**Functional Free Weights Training Facility  
**Achieve your personal training goals in a no-frills training facility. We
believe in sticking to the fundamentals of training and doing them well.  
Our conducive free weights training environment and coaches will keep you both
focused and motivated.

![the-strength-yard-personal-training-
safe](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)![the-
strength-yard-personal-training-safe](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/the-strength-yard-personal-training-safe.png)

**Safe And Sustainable Training Methods  
**The key to progress is to ensure that training stays sustainable based on
your busy schedule. Thus with a measured approach, our coaches will
meticulously plan your training sessions so that it’s both challenging and
achievable.  
A strong foundation in proper form and technique will instill you with the
right lifting habits. You will master the intricacies of each movement safely
under the professional guidance of our coaches.

##

## YOUR JOURNEY STARTS HERE WITH A FREE CONSULTATION SESSION

**Here’s What To Expect During A Free Consultation Session:**

 **→ 1. Lifestyle Enquiry  
**It all begins with a chat with our coach to **learn more about you**.
Information such as your current job type (is it physically engaging or desk
bound), training availability, eating habits, sleeping schedule, any other
habits such as smoking or drinking and etc.. will be important to us during
the planning phase.

**→ 2. Goals Setting  
**Be it if you’re trying to achieve your first pull up or just getting
stronger to do your first spartan race, our coaches will be there to discuss
with you on **how it can be achieved**.

**→ 3. Medical And Training History  
**We would then like to know more about your **medical and training history**.
If you have any concerns regarding personal training or training in general,
do let us know and we will address them.

**→ 4. Movement Assessment  
**This is an important assessment to better understand which area of your body
is **lacking in strength or range of motion**. From this, movement patterns
can be adjusted or taught better and exericse selection can be curated.

**→ 5. Finalizing  
**With the information gathered, our coaches will **lay down the road map and
timeframe** for you to achieve your goals. Now you’re ready to start your
journey to become stronger and leaner.

 **HERE’S WHAT TO EXPECT DURING A FREE CONSULTATION SESSION:**

 **Lifestyle** **Enquiry**  
We would like to know more about you. Information such as your current job
type (is it physically engaging or desk bound), training availability, eating
habits, sleeping schedule, any other habits such as smoking or drinking and
etc.. will be useful to us. The more information we have, the better we will
be able to customize your program.

 **Medical And Training History**  
Have you sustained an injury before or have a certain medical condition that
would be important for us to know? Let us know your concerns regarding
training and we will address them as well. For experienced lifters, we may
request for your past training videos or programs to better understand you.

 **Goals Setting**  
We will then set realistic goals based on the information provided. Our
Coaches will draft out a mock up training plan and run it with you so that you
will have a better understanding.

 **Movement Assessment**  
We may also request you to perform various movements to see your current
condition. This would help to further refine the training program.

# SPORTS MASSAGE

![the-strength-yard-sports-massage](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/the-strength-yard-sports-massage-scaled.jpg)

Jon is certified in **ISA Advanced Sports Massage** and he can help you both
in **preventative and restorative treatments to improve athletic performance**
, **speed recovery** , and can be utilized by all individuals who participate
in any athletic and/or exercise program to **help improve conditioning and
maintain peak performance:**

• Reduce muscle tension

• Promote relaxation

• Increase range of motion

• Improve soft tissue function

• Decrease muscle stiffness and fatigue after exercise

• Improve exercise performance

• Decrease delayed onset muscle soreness

• Reduce swelling

• Enhance athletic performance

• May help prevent injuries when massage is received regularly

## TESTIMONIAL

> **ZANE**

“The massage was up to my expectations, it addressed my tightness in various
muscles and after the session I felt better with less knee pain as well.”
[@zane_ljh](https://www.instagram.com/zane_ljh/)

When a muscle is tight it can irritate nerve receptors within the muscle. This
in turn can lead to feelings of muscular pain and discomfort.  
As for Zane’s case, he has been feeling some discomfort around the patella
area which could be due to the increased training volume from squatting.
Therefore, reducing muscular tension can lead to a reduction in nerve
irritation and a reduction in muscular pain and discomfort.

## **FAQS**

#### What is strength training?

 __

Strength training involves the performance of physical movements that are
designed to improve strength.

Strength training done at The Strength Yard is the learning of compound
barbell movements to become functionally stronger in a safe and trackable
manner, using a science-based approach for our programs.

#### Is strength training safe?

 __

Believe it or not, strength training is one of the safest exercise when
performed under professional guidance coupled with a proper program.

Our certified coaches are practitioners themselves and are experienced in
teaching the proper form and technique in barbell training, based on what
works best for you.

Our programs are customized to your daily fatigue levels which are best suited
for the busy working individuals.

If you are new or unsure about starting strength training, feel free to
approach us for a free consultation session to learn more.

#### What are the benefits of strength training?

 __

Strength training brings numerous benefits to your body:

  * Increase In Muscle Mass
  * Improvement In Bone Density
  * Boost Your Immune System
  * Increase Metabolism
  * Improvement In Day To Day Activities
  * Reduced Risk Of Injury

#### Is it too late to start strength training?

 __

It is never too late to start, we have female clients who started strength
training at the age of 50 and are currently benefiting from it.

Our team of experts are able to adjust the pace and progression of training.

You will gradually build confidence in lifting weights in a safe and non-
judgmental environment.

Reach out to us to arrange a free consultation session to learn more.

# ARTICLES

![The Strength Yard, Singapore 2017.](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/b-300x200.jpg)

## Strength Training And Aging

Leading a sedentary lifestyle leads to muscle atrophy. It is the medical term
that describes the process of your muscles wasting away. When your muscles
aren’t exercised to their full capacity, they begin to break down.

When your body begins to lose muscle, your metabolism slows and you begin to
gain weight. Increased body fat eats away at testosterone, and it can be a
vicious cycle. Low testosterone causes depression, lethargy, and fatigue that
can keep you from exercising to lose fat and build muscle.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/strength-training-and-aging/
"<b>READ MORE</b>")

![the-strength-yard-the-job-of-a-personal-
trainer](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-yard-
the-job-of-a-personal-trainer-e1580356887580-300x300.jpg)

## The Job Of A Personal Trainer

Many often wonder if the cost of having a Personal Trainer is worth it.

The short answer is perhaps. If you have the intrinsic motivation, you can
join a gym and plan your own program independently by referring to the
numerous resources available online, not a problem at all.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/job-personal-trainer/
"<b>READ MORE</b>")

![the-strength-yard-strength-training-and-your-
immunity](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-
yard-strength-training-and-your-immunity-300x200.jpg)

## Strength Training And Your Immunity

Upper respiratory tract infections (The common cold, sinusitis etc.) are the
most common illness that people get. Most are due to an infection with a virus
and the average adult has two to four URTIs each year.

We are constantly exposed to the viruses that cause these infections but some
people seem more susceptible to catching URTIs than others and our immune
system plays an important part that protect us from an army of pathogenic
microbes that bombard the body.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/strength-training-and-your-
immunity/ "<b>READ MORE</b>")

![the-strength-yard-setting-new-year-resolution-
scaled](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-yard-
setting-new-year-resolution-scaled-e1646555181708-300x300.jpg)

## Setting Your New Year’s Fitness Resolution

After a holiday season of being merry, many of us start setting fitness
resolutions for the New year only to see them fall by the wayside.

It Is a pretty depressing statistic. In fact, survey shows that only 20% of
people actually achieve their goals and more than 70% of people give up within
the first 2 months.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/setting-your-new-years-
fitness-resolution/ "<b>READ MORE</b>")

![the-strength-yard-article-introduction-to-olympic-
weighlifting](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-
yard-article-introduction-to-olympic-weighlifting-300x169.jpg)

## Introduction To Olympic Weightlifting

Olympic weightlifting , otherwise known as ‘weightlifting’ or ‘Olympic-style
weightlifting’ is one of the oldest forms of weight training. The moves are
incredibly technical and they take require considerable strength to complete.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/introduction-to-olympic-
weightlifting/ "<b>READ MORE</b>")

![the-strength-yard-when-you-hit-a-plateau-in-training-and-how-to-deal-with-
it](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-yard-when-
you-hit-a-plateau-in-training-and-how-to-deal-with-it-1-300x240.jpg)

## When You Hit A Plateau In Training And How To Deal With It

We know you take your training seriously. From our serious competitive
athletes to our casual class members you are always looking to be the
strongest version of yourselves.

There is only so much we can progressively overload till we hit a wall in
training. Some lucky ones have a higher threshold than others but we’ll all
eventually find our progress starting to get slower or for even some, remain
stagnant for a period of time.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/when-you-hit-a-plateau-in-
training-and-how-to-deal-with-it/ "<b>READ MORE</b>")

![the-strength-yard-managing-fitness-during-
travel](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-yard-
managing-fitness-during-travel-300x225.jpeg)

## Stay Fit While Traveling

Hey everybody, holiday season is upon us and in fact, we have just treated
ourselves to a weekend road trip to Malaysia, tasting the local cuisine and
sampling every type of street food.

While I know many of you will start stressing out over how to remain fit while
on the road, understand that your hard work will not be gone to waste.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/stay-fit-while-traveling/
"<b>READ MORE</b>")

![squat powerlifting champion](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/img_9563-300x225.jpg)

## Powerlifting

The recent rise of raw powerlifting in Singapore and having numerous media
attention lately has many asking what exactly is Powerlifting.

In a nutshell, Powerlifting is strength sport that revolves around the 3
disciplines. The Squat, Bench press and the Deadlift.

[ **READ MORE**](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/strength-training-singapore-
what-is-powerlifting/ "<b>READ MORE</b>")

![the-strength-yard-strength-training-
singapore](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-
yard-strength-training-singapore-300x200.jpg)

## Benefits Of Strength And Conditioning Training

With the rising fitness trend, more people are turning to strength and
conditioning in order to take charge of their body and health. Strength
training has been touted for years to be of great value.

# GROUP CLASSES

# GROUP CLASSES

[ PROGRESSIVE STRENGTH CLASSES MEMBERSHIP
](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/strength-yard-progressive-strength-classes/)

**Master Compound Barbell Movements** to help you get **Functionally
Stronger** and better in your everyday life.

 **This class is suitable for Beginners (both male and female of various age
groups)** and is an ideal option for people who are looking **to become
functionally stronger or to kickstart their Powerlifting Journey.**

[ GOLD CLASS FOR SENIORS MEMBERSHIP
](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/progressive-strength-classes-gold-class-for-
seniors/)

**Similar to our Progressive Strength Class except that it is catered to our
seniors.**  
The gold classes are conducted at a much gentler pace ensuring that no one
gets left behind.

Our well designed regiment will help you **prevent muscle degeneration, combat
the effects of aging and improve your quality of life.**  
Take charge of your health now and join us today!

# PERSONAL TRAINING

_Read About Our Clients’ Testimonials For Personal Training:_

  * [](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/chua/) ![Chua](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/bfi_thumb/dummy-transparent-qbtse8vbaespoav9lu7mxtz1rz5cb9xevipkrq1sug.png)

#####  [Chua](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/chua/)

During the circuit breaker period, I decided to join TSY's since it was
recommended to me by a friend. The combination of the their 1 to 1 coaching
through zoom and proper nutritional coaching allowed me to shred 6kgs....
**Read More**

  * [](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/joled-koh/) ![Joled Koh](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/bfi_thumb/dummy-transparent-qbtse8vbaespoav9lu7mxtz1rz5cb9xevipkrq1sug.png)

#####  [Joled Koh](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/joled-koh/)

When I first came to The Strength Yard, I was just recovering from dengue and
was 114kg, weight gained from medication side effects. I wasn't sure if I was
able to keep up with everyone else and was really hesitant.... **Read More**

  * [](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/divya/) ![DIVYA](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/bfi_thumb/dummy-transparent-qbtse8vbaespoav9lu7mxtz1rz5cb9xevipkrq1sug.png)

#####  [DIVYA](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/divya/)

Ian was much younger than most of the other trainers I have worked out with .
Initially I wasn’t sure if he will understand how to train someone my age
group. However, Ian has completely proved me wrong . His routine has made me

##

## YOUR JOURNEY STARTS HERE WITH A FREE CONSULTATION SESSION

**Here’s What To Expect During A Free Consultation Session:**

 **→ 1. Lifestyle Enquiry  
**It all begins with a chat with our coach to **learn more about you**.
Information such as your current job type (is it physically engaging or desk
bound), training availability, eating habits, sleeping schedule, any other
habits such as smoking or drinking and etc.. will be important to us during
the planning phase.

**→ 2. Goals Setting  
**Be it if you’re trying to achieve your first pull up or just getting
stronger to do your first spartan race, our coaches will be there to discuss
with you on **how it can be achieved**.

**→ 3. Medical And Training History  
**We would then like to know more about your **medical and training history**.
If you have any concerns regarding personal training or training in general,
do let us know and we will address them.

**→ 4. Movement Assessment  
**This is an important assessment to better understand which area of your body
is **lacking in strength or range of motion**. From this, movement patterns
can be adjusted or taught better and exericse selection can be curated.

**→ 5. Finalizing  
**With the information gathered, our coaches will **lay down the road map and
timeframe** for you to achieve your goals. Now you’re ready to start your
journey to become stronger and leaner.

 **HERE’S WHAT TO EXPECT DURING A FREE CONSULTATION SESSION:**

 **Lifestyle** **Enquiry**  
We would like to know more about you. Information such as your current job
type (is it physically engaging or desk bound), training availability, eating
habits, sleeping schedule, any other habits such as smoking or drinking and
etc.. will be useful to us. The more information we have, the better we will
be able to customize your program.

 **Medical And Training History**  
Have you sustained an injury before or have a certain medical condition that
would be important for us to know? Let us know your concerns regarding
training and we will address them as well. For experienced lifters, we may
request for your past training videos or programs to better understand you.

 **Goals Setting**  
We will then set realistic goals based on the information provided. Our
Coaches will draft out a mock up training plan and run it with you so that you
will have a better understanding.

 **Movement Assessment**  
We may also request you to perform various movements to see your current
condition. This would help to further refine the training program.

# GROUP COURSES

Master The Intricacies Of Training With A Barbell With Our Barbell Courses.
Focus On Your Form And Technique To Set A Strong Foundation.

[ BEGINNER OLYMPIC WEIGHLIFTING COURSE
](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/beginner-olympic-weightlifting-course/)

Over the course of 4 weeks, **Individuals will learn and become proficient in
the Clean & Jerk and the Snatch. **This is the foundation of this course.

This is a progressive fundamental course emphasizing technique and form for
novice to advanced weightlifters.

This course is perfect for beginners, men and ladies alike.

[ BARBELL FUNDAMENTALS ](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/barbell-fundamentals-
strength-and-conditioning-gym-singapore/)

Over the course of 2 days, learn how to perform the basic barbell lifts safely
and efficiently under the instruction of our coaches.

This is a workshop designed for beginners to receive coaching on the proper
form and technique for the **Squat, Bench, Deadlift and Overhead Press.**

## **FAQS**

#### What is strength training?

 __

Strength training involves the performance of physical movements that are
designed to improve strength.

Strength training done at The Strength Yard is the learning of compound
barbell movements to become functionally stronger in a safe and trackable
manner, using a science-based approach for our programs.

#### Is strength training safe?

 __

Believe it or not, strength training is one of the safest exercise when
performed under professional guidance coupled with a proper program.

Our certified coaches are practitioners themselves and are experienced in
teaching the proper form and technique in barbell training, based on what
works best for you.

Our programs are customized to your daily fatigue levels which are best suited
for the busy working individuals.

If you are new or unsure about starting strength training, feel free to
approach us for a free consultation session to learn more.

#### What are the benefits of strength training?

 __

Strength training brings numerous benefits to your body:

  * Increase In Muscle Mass
  * Improvement In Bone Density
  * Boost Your Immune System
  * Increase Metabolism
  * Improvement In Day To Day Activities
  * Reduced Risk Of Injury

#### Is it too late to start strength training?

 __

It is never too late to start, we have female clients who started strength
training at the age of 50 and are currently benefiting from it.

Our team of experts are able to adjust the pace and progression of training.

You will gradually build confidence in lifting weights in a safe and non-
judgmental environment.

Reach out to us to arrange a free consultation session to learn more.

#

# SPORTS MASSAGE

![the-strength-yard-sports-massage](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/the-strength-yard-sports-massage-scaled.jpg)

Jon is certified in **ISA Advanced Sports Massage** and he can help you both
in **preventative and restorative treatments to improve athletic performance**
, **speed recovery** , and can be utilized by all individuals who participate
in any athletic and/or exercise program to **help improve conditioning and
maintain peak performance:**

• Reduce muscle tension

• Promote relaxation

• Increase range of motion

• Improve soft tissue function

• Decrease muscle stiffness and fatigue after exercise

• Improve exercise performance

• Decrease delayed onset muscle soreness

• Reduce swelling

• Enhance athletic performance

• May help prevent injuries when massage is received regularly

[Book Now](https://bookeo.com/thestrengthyard?type=3352UX4JPL17D76CCD614)

##

## TESTIMONIAL

> **ZANE**

“The massage was up to my expectations, it addressed my tightness in various
muscles and after the session I felt better with less knee pain as well.”
[@zane_ljh](https://www.instagram.com/zane_ljh/)

When a muscle is tight it can irritate nerve receptors within the muscle. This
in turn can lead to feelings of muscular pain and discomfort.  
As for Zane’s case, he has been feeling some discomfort around the patella
area which could be due to the increased training volume from squatting.
Therefore, reducing muscular tension can lead to a reduction in nerve
irritation and a reduction in muscular pain and discomfort.

# OUR TEAM

##

## ESTABLISHING STANDARDS FOR STRENGTH TRAINING

The Strength Yard aims to promote the development of our Personal Trainers in
establishing the best standards possible. For our clients to achieve the best
results, our trainers are continuously learning and keeping up to date with
the most recent findings in research and strength training practices.

We are grateful that we are about improving people’s lives. We believe
nurturing a relationship of trust and care is as important as imparting
knowledge to our clients during their journey to becoming stronger.

![the-strength-yard-personal-trainer-jon-
wee](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-yard-
personal-trainer-jon-wee-1-scaled-683x1024.jpg)

##

## **JON WEE**

[![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)![](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/iconfinder_104466_instagram_icon_20px.png)](https://www.instagram.com/tsy.brawnyjon/)
**[@tsy.brawnyjon](https://www.instagram.com/tsy.brawnyjon/)**

A previous personal trainer in Singapore Sports Council with numerous
accolades in powerlifting and bodybuilding.

He is also our resident sports masseuse. Jon’s technique is very thorough and
can be adapted to each client’s needs whether it be deep tissue work, trigger
point therapy, fascial and mobilizing techniques and so on.

He has enabled numerous clients to achieve fantastic results via his strong
work ethics as well as his ability to help clients in a way that is both easy
to understand and complementary with their current needs and circumstances

![the-strength-yard-personal-trainer-gerald-
ho](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-yard-
personal-trainer-gerald-ho-1-scaled-683x1024.jpg)

## GERALD

**[![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)![](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/iconfinder_104466_instagram_icon_20px.png)@tsy.geralddddd](https://www.instagram.com/tsy.geralddddd/)**

With a strong background in competitive strength sports and his qualifications
in Sports and Exercise Science, Gerald has a wealth of knowledge to offer his
clients whether they are new to Strength Training, or seasoned athletes
looking to take their sporting achievements to the next level.

Gerald has an innate ability to connect with his clients. His candid nature
allows him to objectively pinpoint flaws and to motivate you to stay the
course.  
While Gerald isn’t at work, you will find Gerald still enriching his life with
fitness. He enjoys Brazilian Jiu jitsu as well as Mountain Biking on the
weekends.

![the-strength-yard-personal-trainer-densun-
boon](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-content/uploads/the-strength-yard-
personal-trainer-densun-boon-1-scaled-683x1024.jpg)

**[![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)![](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/iconfinder_104466_instagram_icon_20px.png)@tsy.akiralifts](https://www.instagram.com/tsy.akiralifts/)**

scene. He never fails to show his determination and has unwavering discipline.

Such is his ethos and it shows in both his work and training.

Look no further if you need someone to help provide a sustainable training
methodology as he will be by your side encouraging and driving you for
progress.

“It’s a constant quest to be the best version of one’s self. Get better
everyday!”

## ALLEN

[![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)![](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/iconfinder_104466_instagram_icon_20px.png)
**@tsy.allenlzw**](https://www.instagram.com/tsy.allenlzw/)

A familiar face in the local powerlifting scene, Allen first discovered his
interest in Strength training at the age of 17 and has since became his
passion.

Do not be fooled by his size as he packs a punch. Being one of our most
consistent athlete on our gym floor, he has developed a strong set of skills
and methods which is what you need to help you discover the benefits and joys
of training and navigate your way to attaining your fitness goals.

![the-strength-yard-personal-trainer-

## SYAHMI

**[![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)![](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/iconfinder_104466_instagram_icon_20px.png)@syamrzmn](https://www.instagram.com/syamrzmn/)**

“Compliance is the science”. Syam’s approach to training focuses on what is
optimal for real-life individuals, instead of what is optimal within a
scientific vacuum.

Syam has helped his clients reach their strength goals by designing effective
goal specific training programs.

He truly has an eye for detail. tracking progress with the diligence of an
accountant.

He also believes in empowering his clients with the knowledge necessary to
take their training to an independent stage, be it working with him purely in
an online fashion as well as our hybrid style programming.

personal-trainer-allen-l-1-e1655003343602.jpg)

![the-strength-yard-coach-jon-wee](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-

content/uploads/the-strength-yard-coach-jaime.jpeg)

##

## JAIME

Having been passionate about athletics his whole life, Jaime started his
journey in Bodybuilding;  
but discovered his interest truly in Strength training and has been
Powerlifting ever since.

His training methodology revolves around fundamental proven principles that
needn’t be too complicated.  
He is a fervent advocate for using the right technical models over mindlessly
getting through workouts, emphasising the importance of balancing injury
prevention and performance enhancement.

With a strong background in competitive strength sports and his qualifications
in Sports and Exercise Science,

Gerald has a wealth of knowledge to offer his clients whether they are new to
Strength Training, or seasoned athletes looking to take their sporting
achievements to the next level.

“Compliance is the science”. Syam’s approach to training focuses on what is
optimal for real-life individuals, instead of what is optimal within a
scientific vacuum.

Syam aims to help his clients achieve their strength goals by keeping workouts
simple, challenging, and tracking their progress with the diligence of an
accountant.

Jon has more than 10 years of experience in the fitness industry. A previous
personal trainer in Singapore Sports Council with numerous accolades in
powerlifting and bodybuilding.

He believes in helping you find the right routine that is not only effective
but is also a complement to your personal life.

“Always make a total effort, even when the odds are against you.”

With her great passion in the world of sports, Charmaine has developed a high
sense of adaptability to new challenges in life that constantly expands her
endurance limits.

Charmaine’s passion is to be able to help people achieve their goal in fitness
through the understanding of their own mind and body, unlocking each
individual’s true potential.

![the-strength-yard-coach-mcgere](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/the-strength-yard-coach-mcgere.jpeg)

##

## MCGERE

“Keep things simple and realistic” is Mcgere’s coaching motto. He focuses on
simple routines done consistently and done right to achieve lasting results.

Combining nutritional coaching together with technical, movement based
strength coaching, Mcgere believes strength training is an impactful and fun
way to approch one’s fat loss journey.

He hopes to help clients develop skills and habits that they can continue to
take with them on their health & fitness journey even as they progress onto
independent training.

![the-strength-yard-coach-randall](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/the-strength-yard-coach-randall.jpeg)

##

## RANDALL

“You are never too old to get strong.” A phrase used commonly by Randall.  
His journey started when he was overweight and managed to cut 30kg in his 1st
year of strength training and has stuck to it since.

Not just talking the talk, he walks the walk by still being an active
powerlifting competitor at 46 years of age  
and he doesn’t plan on stopping anytime soon!

He attributes his longevity in the sport to his clinical approach in training,
prioritising building the proper foundation before anything else.

##

## SERAPHINA

![the-strength-yard-coach-seraphina](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/wp-
content/uploads/the-strength-yard-coach-seraphina.jpeg)

Seraphina has been a sports enthusiast since her teenage years.  
Some of her sporting accolades include competitive dragonboating and endurance
racing before she caught the bug of strength training.

Believing to push herself to be the best she can be, Seraphina is an avid
competitor in the national scene,  
clinching regular podium finishes in her category.  
As head coach of our Progressive Strength Classes, she strongly believes in
the importance of technique and form before progression,  
as well as the right mental approach to training.

With his experience in the strength sports of powerlifting as well as

seeking to assist others in deriving the best results and performance from

# Top Weight Lifting Gyms in Singapore

  * [ March 12, 2021  ](https://mediaonemarketing.com.sg/2021/03/12/)
  * [ MediaOne  ](https://mediaonemarketing.com.sg/author/mediaone/)

![Top Weight Lifting Gyms in Singapore](https://mediaonemarketing.com.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2021/03/Top-Weight-Lifting-Gyms-in-Singapore.jpg)

## **What is weight lifting?**

Weight lifting is a type of strength training exercise that uses weights as
part of the exercise regime. By using free weights such as barbells or
dumbbells and weight machines, these exercises activate and train certain
muscles in the body, allowing you to become stronger.

## **What are the benefits associated with weight lifting?**

Weight lifting goes beyond merely adding strength to your body. It is a great
total body workout that helps to keep you in shape and burns away those excess
body fat.

Here are some of the common health benefits associated with weight lifting:

### **Burns more body fat than cardio**

If you absolutely dread running, then weight lifting is a perfect alternative
to your exercise regime! In fact, lifting weights help to burn more body fat
as compared to cardio exercises.

Weight lifting helps to increase your lean body mass and build more muscles.
As you build and strengthen your muscles, this keeps your body burning fat
throughout the entire day.

### **Lose belly fat**

Does it seem like no amount of exercise can help to get rid of that muffin
top? Perhaps you have been doing the wrong type of exercises all along. Weight
lifting is said to significantly help reduce belly fat. As you lift the
weights to strengthen your muscles, you invariantly end up using your core
muscles during the weight lifting process. This gives you a total abdominal
workout without you having to try too hard!

### **Strengthen your bones**

Lifting weights does not only strengthen your muscles, it trains and
strengthens your bones as well. As you perform a bicep curl for instance, the
muscles will tug at your arm’s bones, triggering the cells in your bones to
create new bone cells.

### **Gives your heart’s health a boost**

Cardiovascular exercises are not the only type of exercise that targets your
heart health. In fact, weight lifting can also give your heart’s health a
boost! As you build more muscle and strength, this fuels your body with energy
to burn excess fat and encourage better blood flow. All of these lead to a
better and stronger heart!

### **Builds your confidence**

Besides helping you build strength, weight lifting also helps to tone your
overall body. When you are in shape, chances are that you will feel good as
well. This helps to boost your self-esteem and builds your confidence levels!

## **How much weight lifting is enough?**

Some of us may associate weight lifting to people with super defined muscles
and veins that appear to pop up at almost every part of the body.

Truth is, it all lies in your weight lifting technique. In fact, you do not
have to be in the gym for a 2 hour session to see visible results! Ideally,
two to three sessions of 20 or 30 minutes of weight lifting exercise over the
entire week can help to significantly improve your strength in no time.

## **How much weight should I lift?**

The amount of weight that you should be using depends on the number of
repetitions that you intend to do. For instance, if you are planning to do
just 6 repetitions, you probably should use a heavier dumbbell compared to if
you were intending to do 12 repetitions.

As a safety precaution, avoid using too heavy weights such that it causes you
pain when you lift the weights. As your body gets used to the weight lifting,
you may then gradually increase the weights used.

## **What are some of the safety tips when doing weight lifting exercises?**

Like any exercise, weight lifting comes with its set of inherent risks. Here
are some tips to ensure safer and effective weight lifting workouts.

### **Always warm up and cool down**

If you are short on time and tempted to go straight to the bench press from
the changing rooms, think twice! While you may be able to still lift those
weights, your muscles may allow you to lift more if they were warmed up.
Warming up helps to stretch and relax those tight muscles, allowing you to
reap the maximum benefits from your weight lifting workout.

Similarly, ensure that you cool down after each workout to allow your muscles
to rest and recover.

### **Learn the proper weight lifting technique**

If you are completely new to weight lifting, it is best to seek professional
help and advice least you injure yourself. Engaging a gym instructor allows
you to learn the proper method of lifting weights based on the target muscle
group.

### **Do not rely on momentum to do the work**

It may be easier to lift your weights up and down quickly. For example, some
people carry the dumbbells up slowly only to let it crash down to the floor.
Doing that does not train the right muscle groups. In fact, it is akin to just
tossing a ball up and down.

To prevent that from happening, use the 2-2-2 method. Take 2 seconds to lift
the weights, pause at the top for 2 seconds before taking another 2 seconds to
return the weight to its starting position.

### **Always breathe when lifting**

Most people tend to forget to breathe when lifting the weights. It is
important to ensure that you are consistently breathing when you lift as you
will need a lot of oxygen to support the lifting action.

For most exercises, it is recommended to exhale when you lift and inhale as
you release. Simply put, always exhale during exertion.

### **Vary your weight lifting routine**

To ensure that you see visible results during the course of your weight
lifting exercise regime, try to mix up your routine. This helps to build
defined muscles throughout your body instead of just a certain area.

For example, you may allocate certain days to the week to focus on building
strength in your arms. The remaining days can be dedicated to training your
legs.

Similarly, vary the weights and number of repetitions. As you gradually build
up your strength, you may start to increase the weights and repetitions while
reducing the rest time in between each set.

# 8 strength & conditioning gyms you should try in Singapore

  * [ Cheryl Tay  ](https://cheryltay.sg/author/cheryl-tay/)
  * [ July 3, 2015  ](https://cheryltay.sg/2015/07/03/)

**Train your body as the machine, not with machines  
**_Keep your training raw and rough with these gyms_

You don’t need fanciful machines to train. Sometimes I get overwhelmed by the
influx of advanced machines in globo gyms especially. For example, it’s not
just TV that you can watch while running on the treadmill. Now you can also
surf the internet and book that holiday you didn’t have time to do in the
office. I wouldn’t be able to run very fast if I’m doing that though.

Dumbbells, kettlebells, barbells, medicine balls and the all-important squat
rack are more than sufficient. No need for the frills and just get back to
basics. Here are **8 strength and conditioning gyms in Singapore** where you
train your body as the machine and not with machines. You won’t find a
treadmill in these places.

Get ready to work out raw and rough:

## **1) Solitude of Strength**

National weightlifting record holder Lewis Chua started [Solitude of
Strength](http://www.solitudeofstrength.com) (SoS) in September 2013. His
2,400 square-feet space has all the equipment every strength athlete can dream
of. SoS is also home of [CrossFit Statera](http://www.crossfitstatera.com),
which is helmed by Head Coach John Cheah, one of Singapore’s top CrossFit
athletes.

If you prefer to plan your own workout, you can pay the walk-in rates of $12
for adults and $8 for students (or get a monthly membership) and do your own
thing. Open gym hours are between 9am to 9pm. Weightlifting classes are held
every Tuesday night and gymnastics classes are held every Thursday night.
CrossFit classes run daily. Personal training sessions are also available.

[![Strength of Solitude \(600x136\)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/Strength-of-
Solitude-600x136.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/Strength-of-Solitude-600x136.jpg)

_Solitude of Strength is located at Blk 37 Lor 23 Geylang. More
at[www.facebook.com/SolitudeOfStrength](http://www.facebook.com/SolitudeOfStrength)._

## **2) UFit**

UFit, Urban Fitness it means, is this 5,000-square-feet facility in the CBD
area which offers personal training, nutrition guidance, physiotherapy, sports
massage and MMA. They are also known for their outdoor group training such as
the UFIT Bootcamp, RunFIT and UFIT Core. No open gym to the public but you can
sign up for a free trial. They also have a huge group of trainers, about 22
the last I checked.

[![2011-10-25-07-55-20](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2015/07/2011-10-25-07-55-20-1024x768.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2015/07/2011-10-25-07-55-20.jpg)

_UFit is located at 87 Amoy Street. More at
[www.ufit.com.sg](http://www.ufit.com.sg)._

## **3) The Pit**

The Pit has been around since 2011 and is known for being a hardcore gym. It
moved to Orchard last September. You get a sense of ‘beast mode’ when you are
there and members are often referred to as ‘PITbulls’. This is where Chew Feng
Yi trains – yes the one who broke all three events at the Global Powerlifting
Alliance on 13 March 2015. Competing in the Under 48kg category, she lifted
150kg, 120kg and 62.5kg in the deadlift, squat and bench press events
respectively.

There is a lot of emphasis on barbell work and the four basic lifts, as
managing director Irving Henson believes in strength before conditioning. You
can sign up for personal training or attend classes like Metcon, TacFit and
Muay Thai. They also have specific sports training for golfers and
triathletes. Open gym is for members only.

[![11221835_812195378848593_6259282446964782678_n](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/11221835_812195378848593_6259282446964782678_n.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/11221835_812195378848593_6259282446964782678_n.jpg)

_The Pit is located at 123 Devonshire Road. More
at[www.pitpersonaltrainer.com.sg](http://www.pitpersonaltrainer.com.sg/)._

## **4) Ritual**

[Ritual](http://www.ritualgym.com) is a boutique gym with a clever HIIT (high
intensity interval training) concept that caters best to working
professionals. Limited to 10 people a class, the same 20-minute workout is run
every half hour so you can book any session that suits your schedule. The
remaining time is for you to shower and grab a protein shake before you get
back to work. Working attire is provided and you train barefoot.

[![Screenshot_2013-12-14-14-35-24-600x354](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2015/07/Screenshot_2013-12-14-14-35-24-600x354.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2015/07/Screenshot_2013-12-14-14-35-24-600x354.jpg)

_Ritual is located at 11 North Canal Rd. More
at[www.ritualgym.com](http://www.ritualgym.com)._

## **5) Grit – Training for Warriors**

Opened in May 2014 down the same road as Ritual, [Grit
](https://cheryltay.sg/grit-training-for-warriors-singapore/ "Grit – Training
for Warriors")is the first and only affiliate of the Training for Warriors
(TFW) system in Singapore. TFW is a physical and mental training programme
created for fighters more than 10 years ago, but you do not have to be a
fighter to take this on. It involves speed, strength and endurance training,
as well as flexibility work. Classes offered include Strength, Power (next
level after Strength), Hurricane Day (metcon) and Active Recovery, limited to
no more than five participants per session.

[![Grit \(600x366\)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/Grit-600x366.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/Grit-600x366.jpg)

_Grit is located at 39D North Canal Road. More
at[www.tfwsingapore.com](http://www.tfwsingapore.com/)._

## 6) The Strength Yard

As you can tell from its name, The Strength Yard is the place where you can
literally build strength. It is also known as the Barbell Club. This is a pure
open strength and conditioning gym with no classes. You can walk in and work
out by yourself at $8 for a day pass or $65 for a month, every day of the
week. Equipment includes squat racks, barbells, dumbbells, kettlebells,
prowler and tyres. It’s not a full functional strength and conditioning gym,
without things like rings and rowers, but it’s enough for most people.

[![1961715_1537582399786896_8857588063685282716_o](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/1961715_1537582399786896_8857588063685282716_o-1024x576.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/1961715_1537582399786896_8857588063685282716_o.jpg)

_The Strength Yard is located at 58 Joo Chiat Place. More
at[www.thestrengthyard.com](http://www.thestrengthyard.com/)._

## 7) Level

Level is a human movement-focused gym where you’ll find pull-up bars,
barbells, rings, ropes, kettlebells and space for squatting, running, jumping,
climbing, lifting and throwing. They offer personal training, partner training
(so you don’t have to train alone) and classes such as ColeMine (HIIT), Friday
Under The Bar (barbell strength work) and Weekend Warrior (boot camp). You can
sign up for a trial too.

[![10497521_336408589844421_5472063604422931265_o](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/10497521_336408589844421_5472063604422931265_o-1024x322.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/10497521_336408589844421_5472063604422931265_o.jpg)

_Level is located at 137 Telok Ayer Street #01-03. More
at[www.level.com.sg](http://level.com.sg/)._

## 8) Sweatshop

I love this name. I feel like I’ve already worked out before going there, LOL!
Focused on circular strength training, they believe your body was meant to
squat, crawl, climb, plank, pull, push, press, rotate, pivot and become the
ultimate dancing machine. Uh huh, dance. No barbells or weight plates, but
there are gym rings, pull-up bars, ropes, clubbells, kettlebells, medicine
balls, punching bags/gloves/pads. You can walk in to use their facilities for
S$30 a month or S$180 for unlimited. They have boot camp, Muay Thai, TacFit or
personal training.

[![1602057_683083808410794_1895211809_o](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/1602057_683083808410794_1895211809_o-1024x768.jpg)](https://cheryltay.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2014/07/1602057_683083808410794_1895211809_o.jpg)

_Sweatshop is located at 18 Boon Lay Way #07-127 Tradehub 21. More
at[www.sweatshop.sg](http://www.sweatshop.sg/)._

Did I miss anyone out? Drop me an email at [[email protected]](/cdn-
cgi/l/email-protection) so I can update this list then!

# Top Gyms In Singapore

  * [ April 30, 2020  ](https://mediaonemarketing.com.sg/2020/04/30/)
  * [ MediaOne  ](https://mediaonemarketing.com.sg/author/mediaone/)

![Top Gyms In Singapore](https://mediaonemarketing.com.sg/wp-
content/uploads/2020/04/Top-Gyms-In-Singapore.jpg)

The fitness industry in Singapore is booming.

In 2020, the industry generated about $24 million in revenue, with a projected
annual growth of 6%. That means, by 2024, the industry will be generating
about $30 million in revenue.

## **So, What’s a GYM?**

GYM = Gymnasium

It’s a building, club, or large room, usually filled with workout equipment,
where people go to do physical exercise and stay fit. They’re common in
learning facilities, as well as fitness centres and athletic centres.

Some people also use the term gym to refer to a fitness centre, an enclosed
area, or room for indoor recreation. The main difference is that a gym doesn’t
necessarily have to be set indoors.

## **Why is Gym Class Important?**

Here are seven awesome reasons you need to start going to the gym:

### **It’s Healthy**

No need to belabour the obvious – hitting the gym is the first step to a
healthy lifestyle. The correlation that exists between exercising and health
is pretty simple and straightforward. Just working out is enough to make you
happier, lose weight, increase your energy levels, reduce chronic illnesses,
and so forth.

### **Gain Confidence**

Hitting the gym will improve your overall look. You’ll lose weight, get
buffed, tone down, and generally appear healthy. Your skin will also improve.
In other words, hitting the gym will work miracles on your body, the result of
which you’ll start feeling so much better about yourself.

### **Relieve Stress**

The gym can be a great stress reliever. When working out, you forget about all
your woes and focus on improving yourself. The body also responds by releasing
endorphins, which leave you with a euphoric feeling. The end result would be
you feeling better mentally.

### **Coordination and Flexibility**

Ever felt rigid or numb when trying to engage in certain activities? You don’t
need to be reminded that you should at least sign up with a gym class near.
The various activities you do in the gym will, in the end, help you develop
better coordination when engaging in other activities, such as playing
basketball, swinging a bar, and aiming an arrow.

### **Socialisation**

This is one aspect of the gym that many people overlook. You just never know
who you’ll meet in your gym classes. You’ll make friends, meet clients, and
grow your network. This is especially true if you’re a freelancer who spends
the bulk of your time alone.

## **Important Tips for Choosing the Right Gym**

There are so many gym facilities in Singapore. While this presents you with
options, it makes it hard for you to single out that one gym that’s perfect
for you.

Luckily for you, here are a few pointers on how to choose the perfect gym for
you:

### **Location Matters**

Choose a gym that’s closer to you. Search around for a gym that’s within a
15-minute walk from where you live or work. Or one you can easily pass by when
heading home from work.

### **Cleanliness**

The hygienic condition of the place you workout matters a lot. You don’t have
to contend with other people’s sweat. It’s also a great idea to check out the
washroom and changing room and make sure everything is up to the required
hygienic standard.

### **Personnel**

It’s the same thing with any business. You have a better chance of succeeding
and realising your health goals by working with a friendly gym instructor and
customer support.

### **Equipment and Facilities**

Make sure the gym you choose has all the equipment and facilities you’ll need
to achieve your goals. If you plan to gain muscles and buff up, then make sure
the gym has free weights. The same applies to those interested in yoga classes
or doing cardio.

### **Access**

Make sure the gym’s work hours meshes with your schedule. The good thing is
that there are so many 24-hour gym franchises in the country.

### **Cost and Contract**

Before you sign up with any gym, be sure to go through their contract and make
sure there are no hidden charges. Will gyms also tend to have coupons and
discounts that you may want to take advantage of.

## **Gym Trends to Should Watch Out For in 2020**

The past few years have seen to it that new gym trends emerge and
revolutionise the entire industry. 2020 is here, and it’s not like it’s about
to make an exception. As the year rolls by, be sure to witness the following
trends:

### **Fitness Tracking Wearables**

Exercising is set to be a little more technologically advanced than it’s been
through the years. Active tracking wearables are finding their way mainstream,
thus becoming even more common.

### **Group Workouts**

Group training is becoming the order of the day. This is not exactly a new
trend, but there’s an upsurge in the number of people enjoying the social
aspect of exercising as a group.

### **Mental Health GYMs**

People are beginning to be more concerned about their mental health, and are
looking for ways to improve it. That explains why mental gyms (such as
hypnotherapy, sleep workshops, and counselling) are increasingly becoming
popular.

### **Family Workouts**

You’ve probably seen many parents exercising with their little ones. It’s a
trend that’s fast picking shape. In fact, many gyms are even offering children
friendly gym sessions, which allows parents to bring their little ones and
have them enjoy dance lessons or team sports as they exercise in a separate
room.

# The top weightlifting gyms in Singapore to refine your technique

[ By: Beatrice Bowers,
](https://www.augustman.com/sg/author/beatricelifestyleasia-com/) Jul 9 2019
1:45 pm

[
](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.augustman.com/sg/wellness/fitness/best-
olympic-weightlifting-gyms-in-sg/&t=The top weightlifting gyms in Singapore to
refine your technique) [ ](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The top
weightlifting gyms in Singapore to refine your
techniquehttps://www.augustman.com/sg/wellness/fitness/best-olympic-
weightlifting-gyms-in-sg/ "The top weightlifting gyms in Singapore to refine
your technique") [ ](mailto:?The top weightlifting gyms in Singapore to refine
your technique&body=https://www.augustman.com/sg/wellness/fitness/best-
olympic-weightlifting-gyms-in-sg/ "The top weightlifting gyms in Singapore to
refine your technique")

[X] Exit Map View

Map View

Sorry, [gym bros](https://www.augustman.com/sg/sg/wellness/fitness/global-gym-
memberships-perfect-jet-setting-gentleman/), but bicep curls do not equate to
weightlifting, no matter how heavy your dumbbells are. Before you come for us
with pitchforks and Molotovs in shaker bottles, hear us out — engaging in
[strength-building
exercises](https://www.augustman.com/sg/sg/wellness/fitness/7-workouts-you-
can-steal-from-the-fittest-guys-of-instagram/) (as the average person does in
the gym) is lifting weights in the semantic sense, but it’s a completely
different breed from the true sport of weightlifting. For that, it helps to
have proper weightlifting gyms at your disposal.

Weightlifting, more commonly referred to as Olympic or Oly lifting, involves
only two movements: the [clean and
jerk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9HyWjAk7fhY), as well as the
[snatch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UBc5N_-xdqo). These highly technical,
explosive lifts engage your entire body, offering a [comprehensive
workout](https://www.augustman.com/sg/sg/wellness/fitness/best-bouldering-
gyms-in-singapore/) that even the average person can benefit from, as long as
proper technique is in place.

A gamut of digital resources exist to help one get familiar with
weightlifting, be it YouTube how-tos or Reddit communities that welcome form
checks. Still, the best way to cut one’s teeth in the sport is to join a gym
that offers specialised classes run by experienced weightlifting coaches as
you’ll gain far more with hands-on guidance.

Olympic weightlifting may still be a niche in Singapore, but there are a
handful of dedicated gyms that let budding weightlifters get familiar with the
snatch, and clean and jerk. These typically feature proper equipment (read: no
hex plates, and actual lifting platforms), weightlifting groups known as
barbell clubs, and legitimate coaches that you can engage personal training
from if you’re willing to invest. Here are some of our picks.

01

The Strength Yard

![olympic weightlifting gyms in singapore](https://images.augustman.com/wp-
content/uploads/sites/2/2022/04/07163748/am-placeholder-img.png?tr=q-60)

The Strength Yard is a strength and conditioning gym housed in a shophouse
along Joo Chiat. The gym itself houses nine lifting platforms open for public
use, along with a six-week-long beginner’s course that zones in on the 101s of
Olympic weightlifting. Each class runs for 90 minutes with only six
participants to a coach, perfect for novice to intermediate lifters looking to
progress their technique in a semi-intimate setting.

02

The Forge

![olympic weightlifting gyms in singapore](https://images.augustman.com/wp-
content/uploads/sites/2/2022/04/07163748/am-placeholder-img.png?tr=q-60)

Lavender’s red-walled Olympic weightlifting facility is the place to be if you
want to be competent, or even proficient at the sport. Patrons pay a monthly
fee and get assigned to a coach who will guide them through a programme
catered to their level. Training typically runs thrice a week, making The
Forge a destination for lifters seriously looking to get better. If the
commitment seems hefty, just remember that one ever got good at anything just
by putting in the bare minimum.

03

Singapore Weightlifting Federation

![best weightlifting gyms in singapore](https://images.augustman.com/wp-
content/uploads/sites/2/2022/04/07163748/am-placeholder-img.png?tr=q-60)

Learn at the hub of Singapore’s professional weightlifting circuit with the
Singapore Weightlifting Federation. They hold a quarterly schedule of
weightlifting workshops that will get registrants familiar with the basics,
lasting just two hours long. While it may not provide the same level of
guidance that other gyms do, this is a cost-effective place to get you
familiar with what Olympic Weightlifting is and whether it’s a sport you’d
like to pursue.

04

Solitude of Strength

![olympic weightlifting singapore](https://images.augustman.com/wp-
content/uploads/sites/2/2022/04/07163748/am-placeholder-img.png?tr=q-60)

Solitude of Strength is run by national weightlifter, Lewis Chua, also known
as The Buffalo. This 5,166 square feet open-air gym holds a variety of
classes, including Max Lift, dedicated to perfecting Olympic weightlifting
movements, as well as guiding members to hitting PRs on their snatch, clean,
and jerk. Personal training is also offered with their weightlifting coaches,
most of whom also compete at a professional level.

# 22 Best Gyms in Singapore [2023]

June 6, 2023 by **Rachel Tan**

![Rachel Tan Profile
Photo](https://ik.imagekit.io/femedia/Profile%20Photos/Rachel%20Tan%20-%20Author%20-%20Profile%20Photo.webp/tr:w-100)

## Gym Singapore

![Best Gym Singapore](https://funempire.b-cdn.net/wp-
content/uploads/2023/01/Best-Gym-Singapore.webp)Best Gym Singapore

Have you been keeping up with your fitness goals? Being at home majority of
the time these past few months might have sparked your motivations to getting
fit, building muscles, losing weight or to leading an active lifestyle. But
let’s admit working out at home can have its limitations. Here’s the good
news. Fitness centres and gyms in Singapore are finally opening up after
months!

Whether you’re into combat sports like boxing, mixed martial arts, boot camps
or just love the atmosphere of the gym, we’ve gathered the **best gyms in
Singapore** where you can break a sweat!

Equipped with the latest equipment and accessories, experienced personal
trainers and/or high-energy group classes like boxing or spin and more, these
fitness centres will surely get you hyped for a workout.

But before we get to that, if you’re interested in participating in fun and
unique [virtual activities and
experiences](https://www.funempire.com/sg/virtual-team-building/) such as a
virtual fitness activity, check out FunEmpire’s [Virtual
SaberFit](https://www.funempire.com/sg/saberfit/) 30-Day Challenge!

If you’re a bodybuilder who loves competing in competitions, Dennis Gym is the
perfect location for you. They are the official sponsor of a prominent
bodybuilding competition in Singapore. Personal training, several programs and
classes, and muscular toning and fitness training are among their specialties.
They provide membership options that range from six months to two years. You
can even get two personal training sessions for free if you sign up with them.

#### Key Differentiators

  2. Flexible membership plans

to exercise and get fit. Whether you’re a beginner who wants to
#JustGetStarted or already a fitness professional, The Gym Pod welcomes you to
enjoy the most private workout you’ll ever get! Looking to have a Gym Pod
placed near you? Let The Gym Pod know your dream location!

The perfect place to get in the right headspace and enjoy a private workout
session. Have an entire gym in Singapore to yourself with access to all
equipment without the need to queue! Rates start as low as $7 per pod session,
talk about affordable! You can also book an individual bike at The Spin Pod as
low as $5.00! Make sure to check them out today.

#### Key Differentiators:

### What are gyms?

Gyms are places where you can go to exercise and improve your physical
fitness. They provide a variety of equipment such as dumbells, weights and
machines such as cardiovascular machines that you can use to work out, as well
as the staff who can help you with your body workouts. Going to the gym for a
workout can help you improve your fitness levels and metabolic rate,
strengthen your core, build muscles and burn calories with cardio training.
There are many different gyms in Singapore, each with its own unique set of
features and benefits. Gyms also have dedicated personal trainers who design
programmes based on different levels. These experienced trainers will ensure
guidance through high intensity interval training to help you reach your
fitness goals.

### Should I get a gym membership?

The answer to this question really depends on your fitness goals and budget.
Gym membership fees can be expensive, but if you go regularly, the cost can be
worth it. However, there are also affordable gyms available. If you are
looking for a place to start getting fit, or want to improve your current
level of fitness, then a gym membership is the best option. Gyms offer a
variety of programmes and a fully equipped gym can cater to most fitness
levels and goals and can be effective for your fitness journey. However, if
you are not sure if you will stick with it, or do not have the budget for it,
then consider starting off with a trial membership or day pass to test out the
gym first before signing up. There are also monthly plans available and it is
essential to sign up for a gym membership or club that offers convenience as
it has multiple locations or is open 24/7. With a membership, you will have
full access to the full range of equipment available hence you should always
look out for membership plans that best suits you!

### What is personal training?

Personal training services are offered in many gyms, which provides one-on-one
training with certified personal trainers. This service is usually more
expensive than a regular gym membership as the trainers have different rates
but can provide great value if you are looking to achieve specific fitness
goals. A personal trainer will design a programme tailored specifically for
you and will help to motivate and guide you through your workouts. They can
also provide support outside of the gym by providing advice on the nutrition
you need, helping to keep you on track and would plan your meals. If you are
looking for extra guidance, want to achieve specific fitness goals or just
need someone to keep you accountable, then personal training may be the right
option for you! The good thing about personal training is that there are no
peak prices but some trainers also offer promotions, seasonal packages. deals
or vouchers and would be in the comfort of your lifestyle. However, if you are
on a tight budget, getting a gym membership would be more suitable for you to
have a sweat sesh, where you can even opt for small groups training or group
fitness classes

### What are the benefits of working out?

The benefits of working out are vast and can be summed up into three
categories: physical, mental and emotional. Physically, working out can help
to improve your overall health by reducing the risk of diseases such as heart
disease, stroke and cancer. It can also help to improve your stamina, increase
your lifespan, make you stronger and keep your body in shape! Mentally,
working out releases endorphins that make you feel good and happy. It can also
help to improve your mood, cognitive function and memory, allowing your mental
wellness to improve. Lastly, emotionally, working out can help to reduce
stress levels, anxiety and depression. It can also help to improve self-esteem
and body image, keeping your mental health healthy. When looking for a gym,
always ensure that it has a wide range of basic equipment such as treadmills
and strength equipment. The experience of working out can also bring joy and
freedom to some. Of course, to achieve your goals, it is vital to stay
committed hence finding highly qualified trainers that will bring out your
passion can be a good option for you.

### What kind of training is available?

There are many types of training that are available in gyms, but the most
popular ones are weightlifting, cardio and bodybuilding. Weightlifting helps
to increase muscle mass and strength and is a great way to burn calories. It
can also help to improve bone density and reduce the risk of injuries. Cardio
helps to improve heart health and aerobic fitness by increasing your heart
rate for an extended period of time. It is a great way to burn calories, lose
weight and increase fat loss. Lastly, bodybuilding helps to sculpt your
muscles and can be done with free weights or machines. You can also look out
for more in-depth training such as metabolic conditioning, conditioning
training programs and resistance training where you will have to engage with
resistance training equipment and resistance training machines. In addition,
it is also important to find a program that best suits you.

Pinterest")Email[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://citynomads.com/best-
lifting-gyms-in-singapore-for-strength-and-conditioning/ "Share on LinkedIn")

Weightlifting has become an increasingly popular way to work out in the last
few years – yup, [amongst women
too](https://www.issaonline.com/blog/index.cfm/2019/for-women-weight-lifting-
is-essential-heres-why). It’s one of the most efficient ways to build muscle
and increase your metabolic rate, and it’s also just really… fun. How else can
you do a [workout](https://citynomads.com/sweat-sesh-style-a-womans-guide-to-
choosing-the-right-workout-wear/) that’s 40% hard work and 60% resting and
chatting with your friends? Here are some of the best lifting gyms in
Singapore where you can get your [heart rate](https://citynomads.com/party-on-
a-bike-best-spin-studios-and-classes-in-singapore-to-get-your-blood-pumping/)
up, your muscles working hard and your sense of community absolutely thriving.

## Strength Avenue

![strength avenue trainers](https://citynomads.com/wp-
content/uploads/2020/10/strength-avenue-trainers.jpg)

Started in 2016, Strength Avenue occupies the second floor of a Boat Quay
shophouse, overlooking the Singapore River. It’s a comforting view to have as
you grind through your sets of squats. Strength Avenue believes that all
people can benefit from being stronger, and their focus on form and technique
means that their training is safe for people of all shapes, sizes and ages.
Trainers plan based on your weaknesses in private coaching; if you prefer to
work out with friends, their semi-private classes include kettlebell training
and barbell training, and are small enough that you’ll receive personal
attention and assessment.

_[Strength Avenue](https://strengthavenue.com.sg/) is located at 57B Boat Quay
Singapore 049846. Open 7am – 9pm, based on class schedule and appointments.
Contact them [here](https://strengthavenue.com.sg/contact/)._

## The Strength Yard![](https://citynomads.com/wp-
content/uploads/2020/10/strength-yard.jpg)

This Joo Chiat gym is perfect for East-siders wanting to get strong. The
Strength Yard is a strength training facility with monthly passes to their
gym, as well as personal training and progressive strength group classes. This
gym is well-known for its fully equipped space and for offering open access to
their space for most hours of the day. Take their classes to learn the basics,
then keep using their open gym at your own convenience!

_[The Strength Yard](https://www.thestrengthyard.com/) is located at 369 Joo
Chiat Road, Singapore 427614, p. +65 6909 7449. Open Mon-Sun 6am – 12am with
card access._

## The Forge![](https://citynomads.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/the-forge-
lifting-gym.jpg)

This private, personal training Olympic weightlifting and barbell club in
Little India believes that Olympic weightlifting should be accessible to
athletes of all levels. They focus on motions like the Snatch, Clean and Jerk,
but have strength and conditioning training as well. ​Training is extremely
personalised and sessions are coordinated between gym-goers and assigned
coaches. You’re recommended to schedule at least three training sessions a
week, each lasting one and a half hours. What better way is there to get
stronger than being held accountable for putting in good, regular practice?

_[The Forge](https://www.theforge.sg/) is located at 451 Race Course Road,
Singapore 218695. Open Mon, Wed, Fri 7am − 10pm, Tue & Thu 2pm – 10pm, Sat &
PH 10am – 1pm. Closed Sun._

## Level![](https://citynomads.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/level-gym-
interior.jpg)

This gym with both branches in the CBD has classes for anyone, at any level.
Try their high-intensity SWEAT class if you want to get your conditioning in,
or their STRUCTURE class if you want to learn the basics of using gym
equipment like barbells, dumbbells and kettlebells. Are you already fairly
fit? Then try SKILL, their flagship class led by current and former
competitive athletes. They have classes for bodyweight movements, handstands
and conditioning – anything you could want to train for. There are also
virtual classes and personal training.

_[Level](https://level.com.sg/) can be found at 137 Telok Ayer Street #01-03
Singapore 068602, p. +65 6222 4766, and 14 Robinson Road #01-00 Singapore
048545. p. +65 6787 9560. Open Mon-Fri 7am – 8pm, Sat-Sun 8am – 1pm._

## Solitude of Strength![](https://citynomads.com/wp-
content/uploads/2020/10/solitude-of-strength-squat.jpg)

Solitude of Strength is easily the biggest functional gym on the island,
making it a no-brainer if space is a concern for you (social distancing,
anyone?). Located in Woodleigh Park just off Braddell Road, coaches here
believe that functional movements can help everybody age better. They offer a
whole range of classes for different levels – FuncFit caters to all levels of
fitness and all ages, while Strongman Classics introduces the techniques of
lifting large amounts of weight and flipping massive tires. Check out their
passes – they have different ones for classes, open gym usage and a
combination of the two. They even have student discounts!

_[Solitude of Strength](https://solitudeofstrength.com/) is located at 48
Woodleigh Park, Unit #6, The Arena, Singapore 357844, p. +65 8123 4362. Open
Mon – Sun, 6.30am – 11.30pm._

### Elevate Barbell Club

![](https://citynomads.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/elevate-barbell.jpg)

This gym is all about getting your basics down and increasing functionality
for people from all different backgrounds. Their basic strength course will
focus on the four most common movements in weight training: the squat, the
bench press, the deadlift, and the overhead press. They have personal training
as well, giving you a structured program and nutrition guidance. When you’re
advanced enough to train on your own, try out their online training where they
program your training for you – you just need to execute.

_Elevate Barbell Club is located at_ 482 Macpherson Road #01-01, Singapore
368194 _, p. +65 8818 9817. Open Mon – Fri 10am − 10pm, Sat – Sun 10am − 6pm._

# 22 Best Gyms in Singapore [2023]

June 6, 2023 by **Rachel Tan**

![Rachel Tan Profile
Photo](https://ik.imagekit.io/femedia/Profile%20Photos/Rachel%20Tan%20-%20Author%20-%20Profile%20Photo.webp/tr:w-100)

## Gym Singapore

![Best Gym Singapore](https://funempire.b-cdn.net/wp-
content/uploads/2023/01/Best-Gym-Singapore.webp)Best Gym Singapore

Have you been keeping up with your fitness goals? Being at home majority of
the time these past few months might have sparked your motivations to getting
fit, building muscles, losing weight or to leading an active lifestyle. But
let’s admit working out at home can have its limitations. Here’s the good
news. Fitness centres and gyms in Singapore are finally opening up after
months!

Whether you’re into combat sports like boxing, mixed martial arts, boot camps
or just love the atmosphere of the gym, we’ve gathered the **best gyms in
Singapore** where you can break a sweat!

Equipped with the latest equipment and accessories, experienced personal
trainers and/or high-energy group classes like boxing or spin and more, these
fitness centres will surely get you hyped for a workout.

But before we get to that, if you’re interested in participating in fun and
unique [virtual activities and
experiences](https://www.funempire.com/sg/virtual-team-building/) such as a
virtual fitness activity, check out FunEmpire’s [Virtual
SaberFit](https://www.funempire.com/sg/saberfit/) 30-Day Challenge!

## Best Gym Singapore

### 1) Dennis Gym

![Dennis Gym - Gym
Singapore](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAMPDwwAAACwAAAAAAQABAAACAkQBADs=)![Dennis
Gym - Gym Singapore](https://funempire.b-cdn.net/wp-
content/uploads/2023/01/Dennis-Gym-Gym-Singapore.webp)Dennis Gym – Gym
Singapore (Credit: Dennis Gym) Key Services| Competition events and personal
fitness training  
---|---  
Website| [www.dennisgym.net](http://www.dennisgym.net/)  
Address| [Locations](http://www.dennisgym.net/location)  
Contact details| [Contact](http://www.dennisgym.net/location)  
Operating Hours| 24hrs Operational  
  
If you’re a bodybuilder who loves competing in competitions, Dennis Gym is the
perfect location for you. They are the official sponsor of a prominent
bodybuilding competition in Singapore. Personal training, several programs and
classes, and muscular toning and fitness training are among their specialties.
They provide membership options that range from six months to two years. You
can even get two personal training sessions for free if you sign up with them.

#### Key Differentiators

  1. Student and senior citizen promotion
  2. Flexible membership plans

#### Client Testimonial

> Great place to workout. Clean and completed equipment. Value for money gym.
> Their access key able to use at all their different outlet Tampines, TS and
> Balestier. Highly recommended!
>
> Yeow Jian Wu

### 2) The Gym Pod

![The Gym Pod - Front View- Gym Singapore
](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAMPDwwAAACwAAAAAAQABAAACAkQBADs=)![The
Gym Pod - Front View- Gym Singapore ](https://funempire.b-cdn.net/wp-
content/uploads/2023/01/The-Gym-Pod-Front-View-Gym-Singapore.webp)The Gym Pod
– Front View- Gym Singapore (Credit: The Gym Pod) **Key Services:**|  Fully
automated, private gyms and private spin classes  
---|---  
 **Website:**| [www.thegympod.com](http://www.thegympod.com)  
 **Address:**|  The Gym Pod Locations:  
JTC LaunchPad, Alexandra TechnoPark, International Business Park, Changi City
Point, TechPlace1 @ AMK  
 _(COMING SOON: Punggol Park & BAMK Park)_  
  
The Spin Pod Location: Changi City Point  
 **Email:**| [support@thegympod.com](mailto:support@thegympod.com)  
 **Operating Hours:**|  24/7  
  
The Gym Pod’s mission is to provide the space, tools, and knowledge for anyone
to exercise and get fit. Whether you’re a beginner who wants to
#JustGetStarted or already a fitness professional, The Gym Pod welcomes you to
enjoy the most private workout you’ll ever get! Looking to have a Gym Pod
placed near you? Let The Gym Pod know your dream location!

The perfect place to get in the right headspace and enjoy a private workout
session. Have an entire gym in Singapore to yourself with access to all
equipment without the need to queue! Rates start as low as $7 per pod session,
talk about affordable! You can also book an individual bike at The Spin Pod as
low as $5.00! Make sure to check them out today.

#### Key Differentiators:

  1. **Privacy** : all of the pods can be privately booked via the mobile app. No uncomfortable distractions, no queueing for equipment, etc.
  2. **Convenience** : fully operational 24/7. The Gym Pod aims to provide a Pod for everyone to use whether they are commuting from work or just want to step outside their home.
  3. **Peace of mind** : No pricey gym memberships or pushy sales staff. Simply download the app and book your session.

#### Customer Review:

> At a time where everyone is worried about contracting COVID-19, I feel as if
> The Gym Pod is the perfect solution. I have not once worried about my safety
